.bashrc tweakage allows for some sweet terminals tho

how do you get ubuntu to install on a hp laptop
obviously, they have problems
try the AlternateCD you can do a full install in text mode then when it is done you can sudo apt-get ubuntu-desktop if you want the GUI
i dont think i can handle a alternat install
it is straight forward and easy to follow

first step to installing linux is getting over the fearof text installs. it really is not that difficult, the fact that you want to install linux is already a big step so have some faith and give it a shot :)
um isnt it like 20 commands?
www.ubuntu.com has the alternate cd you have to check the box before downloading
i have the iso already

the commands are not advanced there are menus and you use the arrow keys to scroll through and ENTER to select . very simple you read carefully and follow the instruction. when in doubt go with the default :)
so its menubased?
menu based in the sense that there will be a list of options when the cd boots
trust me dude you can do this.
i just hope i dont brick a $2500 laptop
I cant promise I cant promise it will go off without any hitches but nothing will break
it wont erase vista if you read carefully. dont just hit enter read everything first. the instructions are clear and simple
im not that much of a nux noob
then take the plunge. you have already made sure that the pool is filled. nothing holding you back now

bootloaderless pc

(don't reply to me) but i think boot-repair or something might help.  or the old school way chroot from a live cd, THEN install grub (FYI the chroot requires MULTIPLE mounting for grub to install correctly - so it's not an easy suggestion, but i'm unfamiliar with boot repair or whaterver it's called).
Hey all... why does my SD card suddenly not identify teh filesystem when I use 'mount'??  Also,  when I run Skype, my digital spdif output signal dies.  Why so?
what filesystem is on the SD card?
standard FAT32.  It's worked up till yesterday (er, today... I apt-get dist-upgraded)

I didn't see any system notification through KDE when I would plug my SD card into the reader, so I checked it out in a command-line shell and saw that using 'mount /dev/sdd /mnt' gave me an error that it doesn't udnerstand the filesystem.
normally it identifies it on its own
'dmesg' definitely detects /dev/sdd though.
have you tried mounting /dev/sdd1?  In linux, the devices are alphabetic characters and partitions are numbers
well yes
er
let me check, actually.
oh that works perfectly (Trhough the ocmmand line, at leat).  Silly me, forgetting the number.
thanks!  Now, why doesn't KDE pick up on this....

I am having a very serious and wierd problem: the file /etc/resolv.conf cannot be accessed or removed, giving the error message 'Stale NFS file handle'. Because of this, I have no DNS capability. How do I fix this? Why would /etc/resolv.conf even be on a networked file system?
-> without resolv.conf you can not resolve names to ip address
yes, i am aware that i can't resolve names, and it's very annoying :)
-> cant you relate?  network file system  -- to resolve those network addresses you require resolv.conf
